{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3575725,"name":"Landon","username":"Lfehr","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/l/47e85d/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-04-01T01:07:57.197Z","cooked":"

When we turn off our bot and then turn it on it our vision with led works and the it shows that the vision in swerve periodic is running, but if you restart robot code or restart robo Rio it doesn’t run the vision in the swerve periodic or sometimes after 10 minutes it randomly starts working.
Here is our code: GitHub - 7657thunderbots/FRC2025-REEFSCAPE

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2025-04-01T01:07:57.197Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":8,"reads":64,"readers_count":63,"score":52.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":497609,"topic_slug":"issues-with-vision-on-restart-of-robot-code","display_username":"Landon","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.com/7657thunderbots/FRC2025-REEFSCAPE","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"GitHub - 7657thunderbots/FRC2025-REEFSCAPE","clicks":1}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53962,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/issues-with-vision-on-restart-of-robot-code/497609/1","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3575770,"name":"Ishan Sinha","username":"Is-han-solo","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/is-han-solo/{size}/165834_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-01T01:35:15.930Z","cooked":"

From taking a quick look, and I may be wrong, it seems like your vision system isn’t being fully reset when you restart the code versus doing a full power cycle. When you power cycle a robot, all the hardware and dependencies (ie network table connections and camera states and even your vision system) gets completely reinitialized. To my understanding, some of that state might persist on a code restart, which can cause the vision updates to be delayed or not run at all.

Here are some things I would check to help diagnose:

Initialization Order

  • Make sure that every part of your vision system (like the PhotonVision camera and network table listeners) are reinitialized when the code restarts.
  • Consider adding a reinit method or extra logging in robotinit to confirm everything is set up correctly (this is a general rule I followed in 2023 before I graduated to have a quick look to make sure “all systems were up and running” – it helps your drive team A TON as well).

Network Tables

  • PhotonVision relies on network tables to receive data. A code restart might not fully reset these connections, so check that they’re reconnecting properly.

Timing/Debounce Logic

  • The vision update code has debounce logic to limit how often data is fetched. If this isn’t reset correctly on a restart, it might block new updates.
  • Adding some logging around this area could also help pinpoint the problem

TLDR: log every step of your code from restart to everything “up and running again” to pinpoint the issue. Just a quick teaching moment as well – this is called “print debugging” and is something you may have to get very used to in industry, should you choose to go in the software world

With all that said, I took a very quick peak at your code and could be very wrong (as I am an unc essentially now), but I just decided to drop some insight just in case it could help. Good luck!

We started that and for some reason we found this odd fix to just have it print cameras available and it fixed it.
